title: Maestro Error everytime and anywhere!
body:
I play LoL since 2013 and never had this problem. This is happening since the beginning of this season.

It does not matter where I am... in the client, in spectator mode, or in the match...Bug Splat window pop out and then shows the Maestro Error message.
If I'm in the middle of the game, it continues. But when it's over, I have to open the game again, because the Client is closed.

One detail that I think is worth mentioning, the open LoL contains 4 .exe processes running: LoLClient.exe, LolLaucher.exe, Lolpatcher.exe and rads_user_kernel.exe.
I realized that Lolpatcher.exe and LolLaucher.exe closes in the moment that bug splat window appears, and I get Maestro Error about 4 seconds later. 
(If I close them manually, I get the same Maestro Error).

Things I've already tried:

Reinstall the game (5 times with cleaning install)
Reinstall Windows 10
Formatted my PC
Allow all LoL executables in Windows Firewall
Disabled the firewall, including the Windows Firewall Service.
Install LoL in another folder.
Put all executables LoL in compatibility mode with Windows Xp, 7 and 8.
Put to run All LOL .exe in Administrator mode

And all things form TROUBLESHOOTING CONNECTION ISSUES


The bug splat log shows this:

LoLPatcher caused ACCESS_VIOLATION in module LoLPatcher

Write to location 706f0e90 caused an access violation.

User Information: 
User Name: ablon 
Computer Name: PC-RENAN

System Information: 
6 processor(s), type 586. 
35% of memory in use. 
8189M total physical memory. 
5287M free physical memory. 
12189M total paging file. 
9136M free paging file. 
2047M total virtual memory. 
1896M free virtual memory.

Process Memory: 
1896M free. 
54M reserved. 
97M commited. 
Largest free block is 1289M.

PageFaultCount: 29267 
PeakWorkingSetSize: 34M 
WorkingSetSize: 34M 
QuotaPeakPagedPoolUsage: 0M 
QuotaPagedPoolUsage: 0M 
QuotaPeakNonPagedPoolUsage: 0M 
QuotaNonPagedPoolUsage: 0M 
PagefileUsage: 23M 
PeakPagefileUsage: 25M

Plz, help me.

P.S. Sorry my bad english.

replies.body:
Hmm...this is actually an incredibly weird issue because BugSplat errors and Maestro errors point to two completely different things.  BugSplat errors point to some sort of hardware/software problem with League of Legends (a generic crash if you will).  However, a Maestro error is something that PvP.net (the client) uses to make sure that you are properly connected to our servers.  Maestro is primarily used with the client, which is why LoLLauncher.exe (the client), closes when you experience this issue.

It seems that you have tried a lot of steps already, so make sure to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  One of our Tech Specialists should be able to work with you and investigate one-on-one until this issue is resolved.  Just make sure to provide the following info:

1) [Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1)

2) [Network Information Log](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4)

3) [Process List](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3)

I play on BR Server, I open 2 tickets there with ALL logs that you mentioned above (and a Lot of others logs), but I did not get any help with those automatic answers.
And in the Boards none of the RIOT guys appeared.

The best advice I can give is to reply to the response you get in your ticket with whatever information they request!  Eventually you will be escalated to one of our Tech Specialists who can help you out!
